intro: Laggera humilis, commonly known as the small laggera, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters. Laggera humilis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
